channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Trump's birther lie about Kamala Harris magnifies racist themes of his campaign
item.description: President Donald Trump once again drove the dignity of the American presidency into the ditch this week by raising a false and racist conspiracy theory about Kamala Harris, elevating the efforts of the alt-right to portray her as "other" because of her mixed-race heritage.

item.title: Jared Kushner asked about 'birther' attack on Kamala Harris
item.description: CNN's Christiane Amanpour talks to Jared Kushner about Trump and the recent birtherism attack on presumptive Democratic vice presidential nominee Kamala Harris.

item.title: Doubts spread around the world over Covid vaccine
item.description: Susan Bailey, a 57-year-old retired nurse from Florida, has had all her jabs and gets a flu shot every year. She's a vocal Joe Biden supporter -- and one of a growing number of people globally who say they wouldn't take a coronavirus vaccine even if one becomes available soon.

item.title: New Zealand records seven new locally transmitted cases as latest outbreak continues
Lyon stun Manchester City to reach Champions League semifinals
item.description: Lyon stunned Manchester City on Saturday to qualify for the semifinals of the Champions League, winning 3-1.

item.title: Overcrowded, overpriced and overwhelmed. The UK's Covid-19 staycation nightmare
item.description: Beaches strewn with waste, wild campers destroying fragile habitats, warnings from an increasingly overstretched Coastguard, unaffordable accommodations. What was supposed to have been a Great British summer has, for many, become a staycation nightmare.

item.title: British tourists rush back from France to avoid quarantine
item.description: Thousands of British holidaymakers have been trying to return home from France in an attempt to avoid new quarantine restrictions imposed by the UK government.

item.title: Pandemic power play: It's China vs. US in Latin America
item.description: At first glance, the picture China's ambassador to Barbados tweeted on July 23 shows nothing more than an online meeting — a typical, screen-based representation of what life has become during the pandemic.

item.title: Family evacuated from Wuhan compares China and US virus responses
item.description: A Tennessee family evacuated from Wuhan, China, as the coronavirus pandemic exploded around the world say the difference between the way the US and China handled the virus is "night and day." CNN's Brianna Keilar reports.

item.title: Faulty election mailers create confusion
item.description: Mailers meant to help voters with the absentee voting process amid the ongoing pandemic are instead sowing confusion for voters and leading some officials to levy allegations of attempted voter suppression ahead of the November election.

item.title: Taiwan risks being caught up in the power struggle between the United States and China
item.description: It took less than 24 hours after United States Secretary of Health and Human Services Alex Azar touched down in Taiwan, in an historic visit intended to convey President Donald Trump's support for the democratic island, for China to deliver its own message.

item.title: The US-China fight began with trade. Now it's the one thing still working for them
item.description: Tensions between the United States and China have soared as the two superpowers fight over everything from the coronavirus pandemic, human rights and Hong Kong, to who controls the technologies of the future.

item.title: Trump orders TikTok's Chinese-owned parent company to divest interest in US operations
item.description: President Donald Trump issued an executive order Friday evening directing ByteDance, the Chinese-owned parent company of TikTok, to divest interest in the app's US operations within the next 90 days.

item.title: He could make history as the US's first 'second man'
item.description: Kamala Harris' husband, Doug Emhoff, could make history as the first "second man" in the nation's history. CNN's Kyung Lah reports.

item.title: A 12-year-old girl was caught on camera gambling at an Australian casino
item.description: A 12-year-old girl was among three minors caught gambling at a casino in Sydney, Australia, regulators said Saturday.

item.title: Marge Simpson responds to Trump adviser's Kamala Harris comparison
item.description: Doh! Politics have really gotten serious when a beloved but fictional animated character feels compelled to defend herself against a real-world slight.

item.title: Must-watch videos of the week
Hong Kong media tycoon says 'the fight has to go on' after 'symbolic' arrest under new law
item.description: Hong Kong media tycoon Jimmy Lai has called his arrest a "symbolic exercise" by local authorities to demonstrate that the sweeping national security law imposed by Beijing last month has "teeth."

item.title: How these images changed a woman's family history
item.description: Her uncle's decision to fight in World War II horrified his conservative Mennonite family, who rarely spoke of him even after his death. She discovers the truth about his service decades later.

item.title: Inside the multibillion dollar vaccine race
Barcelona dropped from Champions League in historic loss
item.description: Bayern Munich scored eight times against Barcelona to help the German side inflict a record defeat on the Catalans to advance to the Champions League semifinals, winning 8-2.

item.title: Bernie Sanders: Trump is crazy, not stupid
item.description: In an interview with CNN's Anderson Cooper, Sen. Bernie Sanders (D-VT) said President Donald Trump is "crazy, not stupid" when it comes to the plan he told Fox Business about in an interview to withhold funds for USPS over mail-in ballots.

item.title: India cricket legend MS Dhoni announces retirement from international competition
item.description: India cricket legend MS Dhoni announced his retirement from international competition on Saturday, marking the end to his 16-year career with the India National Team.

item.title: Greenland's ice sheet has melted to point of no return
item.description: Greenland's ice sheet has melted to a point of no return, and efforts to slow global warming will not stop it from disintegrating. That's according to a new study by researchers at Ohio State University.

item.title: Resident: Why should we leave Beirut to crooks and thieves?
item.description: Reports of the demise of Beirut are greatly exaggerated. This year has brought economic devastation, the coronavirus pandemic, civil unrest, political instability and a blast many residents liken to the bombing of Hiroshima. Yet residents tell CNN's Ben Wedeman they, and their city, will rise again.

item.title: Belarus riot police drop shields and are embraced by anti-government protesters
item.description: At least 50 Belarus security personnel in riot gear dropped their shields and were embraced by anti-government protesters in Minsk, as demonstrators chanted "brothers" at the police.

item.title: Famed Indian film singer on life support in ICU
item.description: One of India's most renowned film singers, SP Balasubrahmanyam, is on life support following hospitalization for Covid-19, the hospital treating him said in a bulletin Friday.

item.title: Chef José Andrés helps feed people in Beirut after deadly explosion
item.description: Anderson Cooper talks with Chef José Andrés, who is in Beirut with World Central Kitchen helping feed people after the deadly explosion. Anderson Cooper Full Circle airs Monday, Tuesday and Friday at 6p E.T.

item.title: Brazil's Christ the Redeemer statue and Sugarloaf Mountain reopen Saturday
item.description: Two of Brazil's best known tourist attractions -- the Christ the Redeemer statue and Sugarloaf Mountain -- have reopened after being shut for five months due to the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: US disrupts millions of barrels of Iranian fuel shipment
item.description: A multimillion-dollar fuel shipment from a designated foreign terrorist organization in Iran to Venezuela was disrupted by the Justice Department, according to a Friday news release.

item.title: Lifelong Republican: I'm voting Biden because I'm disgusted
item.description: Some Republicans voters in Arizona say they are dissatisfied with the way President Trump has handled the response to coronavirus pandemic and are organizing to defeat him in 2020. CNN's Miguel Marquez reports.

item.title: We landed dream jobs as caretakers of an Irish island -- then Covid struck
item.description: It was Valentine's Day this year that Dublin couple Annie Birney and Eoin Boyle found out they'd landed what might just be the world's most romantic job.

item.title: 'China's Netflix' is being investigated by the SEC for alleged fraud
item.description: Investors are getting nervous about iQiyi, the online streaming provider often referred to as the "Netflix of China," as regulators examine allegations of inflated earnings.

item.title: Take a look inside Tokyo's drive-in haunted house
item.description: A Japanese performance group has created an experience that follows social distancing guidelines yet remains absolutely terrifying -- a drive-in haunted house.

item.title: The Man Utd teenager who is a superstar in the making
item.description: There was a period during the winter of 2008 when every Saturday night Paul Newsham's Yorkshire home would sound like old telephone exchange switch room.

item.title: Dramatic aerial photos showcase China's wild 'crimson beach'
item.description: No bathing suits are required to enjoy this Chinese beach.

item.title: Now this is a Blockbuster Airbnb
item.description: You can -- and should -- eat popcorn in bed at this one-of-a-kind Airbnb. Located in Bend, Oregon, this rental has everything: a sofabed, free snacks, a VCR and a big TV.

item.title: Pentagon to start investigating UFO sightings
item.description: The Pentagon has formed a new task force to investigate UFO sightings observed by the US military, according to defense officials.

item.title: This village runs 100% on solar power
item.description: Near Morocco's sunny Atlantic coast, the tiny community of Id Mjahdi is being touted as Africa's first completely solar-powered village.

item.title: Michael Jordan's game-worn sneakers set new record, selling for $615,000
item.description: A pair of Nikes worn by Michael Jordan has broken the record for the most expensive sneakers ever sold at auction, fetching $615,000.

item.title: Chrissy Teigen unveils baby bump
item.description: Supermodel Chrissy Teigen displayed her baby bump in a social media post, confirming that she's expecting her third child with John Legend.

item.title: This is what it's like when a country actually bans TikTok
item.description: Jaya Lall first joined TikTok in early March to make a slideshow set to music for her friend's birthday. But the short-form video app took on new significance to her three weeks later when India went into a coronavirus lockdown, forcing her to close the preschool she runs in the country's capital, New Delhi.

item.title: The Red Bull heir, a crashed car and the scandal that angered Thailand
item.description: Before dawn on September 3, 2012, a roaring black Ferrari struck a police motorcycle in downtown Bangkok, knocking the officer to the ground and dragging his body down the darkened street before speeding away.

item.title: Why I quit Google to clean up India's lakes
item.description: When Arun Krishnamurthy was a teenager, he witnessed a pond near his home in the suburbs of Chennai, India, fill up with trash.

item.title: 'Fox eyes': Harmless makeup trend or cultural appropriation?
item.description: "Ching chong eyes!" That's what elementary school kids used to call Sophie Wang. It was an insidious racist slur casually thrown around as they mocked her Asian ethnicity while pulling on the corner of their eyes. Upward for Japanese. To the side for Chinese. Downward for Korean.

item.title: Analysis: US presidential candidates have been accused of many things. But personal attacks only go so far
item.description: American presidential candidates have been branded through the ages as pimps, crooks, accessories to rape and murder, drunks and even likened to a "hideous hermaphrodite." But until now, no one has accused their rival of plotting to "hurt God" -- as the hardly devout President Donald Trump claims of Joe Biden.

item.title: Analysis: A big sign Trump is a weak candidate
item.description: It's often been said that President Donald Trump is "underperforming the fundamentals". Some believe Trump's doing worse than the average Republican president would be doing in the polls under similar circumstances. It's difficult to prove that, however.

item.title: Opinion: Republican calls for condemning the 'birther' attack on Kamala Harris
item.description: Here we go again.

item.title: Don Lemon: Guess how many of Kamala Harris' GOP colleagues stood up for her?
item.description: After President Trump floated a baseless birther theory about Sen. Kamala Harris (D-CA), CNN's Don Lemon said his producers reached out to all 53 of Harris' GOP colleagues in the Senate for comment.

item.title: Belarus leader calls Putin to reaffirm mutual cooperation, rejects foreign mediation offers
item.description: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko on Saturday rejected foreign mediation offers to help stabilize the volatile situation in his country. But reached out to Russian President Vladimir Putin with a call, and both men expressed confidence that the situation would "be resolved soon," according to a read out of the call published by the Kremlin.
